comments.body: I started with the list in the ubuntu-slim image. Then from the remaining packages (`apt list --installed`), I ran `apt-cache rdepends --installed --no-recommends` to find the "root" packages. I made a call for each of those as to whether it was needed. I was tempted to remove everything that wasn't required for apt-get to run, but decided to keep some standard tools (e.g. ping) for the first iteration. When we have more time we can reevaluate some of those optional packages.
I thought about making a full list of all the remaining dependencies and adding a justification for each one, but I was worried it would fall out of date too easily...
Maybe put your first reply into a comment?
